alert.note: Alert for Morris; Sussex; Warren (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 27 at 5:45PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Morris, western Sussex, Warren and northeastern Northampton Counties through 630 PM EDT... At 545 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Hope, or 14 miles southwest of Newton, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Newton, Dover, Hopatcong, Hackettstown, Wharton, Washington, Rockaway, Blairstown, Mount Arlington, Stanhope, Netcong, Belvidere, Oxford, Hope, Branchville, Andover, Brass Castle, Lake Mohawk, Greendell and Millbrook. This includes Interstate 80 in New Jersey between mile markers 2 and 37. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
